p: Lemon verbena ( Lippa citriodora Kunth.) is a shrub with scented leaves, from the family Verbenaceae, which grows in tropical and subtropical regions. The leaves of lemon verbena are utilized as seasoning for food preparations and also for flavoring beverages. Historically, the leaves been used for their strong scent as an insect repellant (Ebadi, Azizi, Sefidkon, & Ahmadi, 2015; Pascual, Slowing, Carretero, Mata, & Villar, 2001).
